original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, turnover tops 5mn
original_body_lines: The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Wednesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.08 percent, or 8.63 points, at 10,603.
The S&P SL20 index was down 0.24 percent, or 7.32 points, at 3,045.
Turnover was high at 5 billion, the highest since July 13. Most of this came from the Materials Industry (4.2 billion).
“We saw a stake change of 58.8% changing hands in Agstar Plc. Altogether 286.5 million shares changed hands, which boosted the turnover in terms of the index,” a market participant said.
“Banking saw a bit of a sliding down, it pushed down the index with it.”
Positive contributors to the ASPI were Ceylon Tobacco Company (up at 1.93), Central Finance (up at 1.46), and Hayleys Plc (up at 0.97). (Colombo/Dec20/2023).
